instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used on determining the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands?
Output: The related study used visible and nir remote sensing spectrum on determining the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on determining the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands?
Output: Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Independent Components Analysis (ICA), Minimum Noise Fraction rotation (MNF), First-order differential (L′), and Second-order differential (L′′) were used as spectral feature processing methods to determine the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the prediction accuracy on determining the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the prediction accuracy of soil organic matter (SOM) in the study was the coefficient of determination (R2), the concordance correlation coefficient (CCC), the root mean square error (RMSE), and the ratio of performance to deviation (RPD).

instruction: What environmental variables were considered in the study on determining the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands using machine learning models?
Output: The environmental variables considered in the study on determining the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands using machine learning models were mainly the clay index.

instruction: Can the spectroscopic method be used to determine the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands, as stated in the purpose of the related study?
Output: Yes, the spectroscopic method can be used to determine the spatial distribution of soil organic matter (SOM) in cultivated lands, as stated in the purpose of the related study. The study mentions that machine learning models based on spectral data and environmental variables were established to predict the overall spatial distribution of SOM. The Random Forest (RF) model, which is based on spectral data, had the best prediction effect with high accuracy. Therefore, the spectroscopic method is effective in determining the spatial distribution of SOM in cultivated lands.
